If you're someone who frequents PF Changs or thinks Panda Express is actually good, chances are you WILL NOT like this place. They serve traditional, authentic, Chinese food. Not the Americanized versions you get at Changs or Panda.  Yes they have many dishes similar to that of PF Changs. The difference: the sauces/marinades are much lighter & not as sweet & they do not use corn starch to thicken everything up. By authentic & traditional, I mean what you would find in the market place & restaurants IN CHINA is what is served here.  If you've eaten in Chinatown in So Cal or Alhambra, this is the same...minus the shrimp tank. 

Everything is served family style. Your dishes come out 1 or 2 at a time depending on how many people are at your table & how busy it is.  If you want your entire order to arrive at once you very well may be disappointed.  Try the seafood hotpot (octopus, squid, scallops), beef chow fun with gravy (its a minimal amount of gravy but also comes dry), eggplant & tofu, & Mongolian beef (lots of sliced onion, some scallions).  I was here with 7 others, we ordered 5 dishes & veg egg roll, & it was plenty. No takeaway!!  With hot tea the bill was under $45.  Everything was cooked properly, thoroughly, & was very flavorful.  Oh!  True traditional items are listed on the wall: kidney, brain, chicken feet. 

Another reviewer mentioned how crummy the service was. Remember this: You're not only in an authentic Chinese restaurant, you're in Chinatown.  Its a different culture. Don't place your American expectations on them - you will always be disappointed. If you don't like it then exercise your right to not return.  This place has a strong & loyal Chinese & vietnamese following...they aren't closing their doors for lack of business. 

Enjoy!!
Man the whole fried flounder is just great. I also like the salty fish and pork and sweet and sour pork. Prices are so low i dont know how they can make a profit.

They brought out the food first n soup last which was odd. First Chinese to ever done that. We ordered the Wonton Soup (not that great. Also, we ordered smoothie and they gave it to us in a small red plastic cup like smaller than the water cup. Expensive $5 smoothie.

Service is another story, about 3 stars-- but go for the food, not the service!

Food is below average,  but service was aceptable.  We ordered a whole roast duck and it wasn't fully cook.  I still preferred Sam Woo over this place.  Chow mein, magnolia beef, spicy pig ear, and calm with mint leaves was so so.  Overall panda express is much better than this place.

good food except for steamed seabass. youll know if it frozen and not worth the price. yang chow was superb amd the generals chicken. beef broccoli was also tasty and flavorful. will definetely comeback but will avoid the steamed fish coz its not fresh

Seating is quit close from each other.

Service good.

First time at HK Gardens... it won't be the last !!! Hot n Sour soup was excellent !!! Singapore Noodles were also delicious. Service was great and prices were very reasonable! They even gave us Free Dessert !!! Highly recommend, can't wait to go back !!

Server was nice but she was spread way too thin which = bad service
We ordered 2 entrees (1 Mongolian beef and 1 steamed chicken with veggies) and salt and pepper squid as an appetizer. The Mongolian beef came out first, we waited seeing if the appetizer would come or at the very least some rice. Well the rice came literally 10 mins after the first entree, then the chicken and appetizer was nowhere in sight. We cancelled the appetizer and attempted to eat the entrees, which were OKAY but definitely not worth all the drama. Mongolian beef was decent but the steamed chicken was NOT good, the chicken looked malnourished literally no meat but was seasoned nicely at least. They brought out come corn egg drop soup which lacked flavor but it was free so whatever. The lack of attentiveness (white rice 10 mins after entree arrived) and them basically forgetting the appetizer was the last straw, l will never go back

My wife and I were looking for a Chinese restaurant at 10pm and yelping as we went. This restaurant was fairly busy and had good reviews, so we decided to try it. We are from Hawaii, where there are quite a few Chinese restaurants so we thought ordering would be easy. Wow, the menu was quite extensive and some of the dishes were not familiar. We choose the crispy chicken and salt & pepper squid. The food was good and no complaints.

Another wow on the portions. We had more than enough for breakfast. 

The service was great and they even comped soup and dessert for us. I would definitely return here on our next trip to Vegas.  Mahalo.

Went here two Saturday nights ago. Very busy but that is what drew us in. We had planned on dining at the center across the street, however, due to lack of parking we crossed the street to the center where Hong Kong Garden was. We drove by and saw almost every table was filled and with Asian people (good sign for a Asian restaurant). So we dined here. 

I would probably give it four and a half . The service was abrupt. Which didn't bother me but they were all business. Very matter of fact, quick service quick food but not rude just felt busy.  But they offered us free soup, we didn't have it because we ordered fish maw but it was still nice they offered and we were provided with some free dessert. I still don't know what the dessert was, it was a yellow sweet broth with what seemed to be a chicken base and maybe some sort of root vegetable in it. 

They seemed very authentic as to what the menu offered. Many dishes such as duck tongue etc. We had the eggplant hot pot, the beef was a little too fatty for me but hubby loved it. I guess fat = flavor, however, I still would have preferred it a little leaner. The eggplant was good too, and there was not thick sweet cornstarch coating as in most fast food Chinese places.  Also, we had the BBQ half duck - yum! and a great price I believe we paid around $10. About a quarter of it was too bony though with little to no meat, but that is to be expected for duck. The table next to us had giant clam - it looked very impressive. 

The fish maw was bland but the waitress informed us it is popular, just not our taste. 

Worth a try if you are looking for authentic Hong Kong style cuisine...

Used to be my place to go when after work. But tonight I'm kinda disappointed of the food and service. I see no smile on servers' faces and no one asked us if we're doing alright after the food came out. we ordered some crispy pork as appetizer but it was out after everything else. when I tried it, it's so dry and hard to chew, definitely was MICROWAVED. They could just told us that they ran out or it's no longer fresh, but no, they didn't even say anything but ok. I guess they didn't care about customers. The black pepper beef on the hot plate looked fine but the beef was not fresh. It tasted like it's been over couple days before cooking. STINK. The seafood tofu pot and the string beans were really good, but I'm not going to be back after tasted the microwaved pork and the stinky beef. Hope they clean their kitchen, or else they'll be close for business AGAIN for DIRTY DINING, which happened last year.

Awful service, hard to flag down a wait staff. They try not to make eye contact. Food isn't that great, for a Cantonese restaurant it's not really that great quality. Been here twice and. Don't think I would try for a 3rd.

I've been here about 4 times, and I would say that the food is actually not so bad, but I mean, it would be much better if certain dishes didn't come more cold than the other dishes (just took too long to come out).
Service is actually pretty slow: asked for two cups of water and that took about 6 minutes itself. Also, normally waiters/waitresses constantly check up on tables, however we were only checked up on, once, and it was only to refill water.
Finally coming to the reason why I will not visit again, my last visit with 4 other friends and we order the calamari, pork fried rice, salt and pepper, wonton soup, and steamed rice, and each dish had about a 5-10 minute wait in between. Into us leaving all full, and finished, the waitress (with a heavy Chinese accent) stopped us to review our check. Wondering why she stopped us, we double check to see if the total amount is written out right, which ends up being right, the waitress points at the blank tip sign. She then asks "why no tip?" and in which my friends and I respond "we all have card" (and to the point where service was bad in the beginning, we agreed not to tip). She had then said "but you can leave tip on the card" which we already knew, but had decided not to leave one (once again, due to not so great service). At this point she is basically asking us to leave her a tip, while holding the bill, staring at all of us having this irritable expression. At this point, a tip shouldn't even be deserved when telling us to come back just to question why we didn't leave a tip (we were already heading out the door).
Extremely rude waitress, not really sure why she is still serving people if this is how she treats a group of 20 year olds.

We only had two nights in LV and we wasted our calories here for dinner.  

The soup of the day was tasty.  

Clams with green onions and ginger was thickly sauced.  I can still feel the sandy grit in my teeth.  The green onions were the best part of the dish.  

Fried tofu stuffed with shrimp needed more flavor.  Good thing it came with sauce.  

Roast pork was thinly sliced and could have used more flavor. It was sliced thicker than paper but we could have used more pork.  I don't even think the meat weighed more than a quarter pound.  

Yee fu noodles were so so. 

They had the largest and heaviest water glasses ever. The place was packed with Chinese peeps.  Those peeps have different taste standards.  

Bottom line = needs more flavor.

The service is excellent. All the workers, not just our waitress, are tentative and helpful. The place was clean and tidy. It had a bad layout though, with all the tables near the big door. So everytime someone walks in, you get a chilly windlash. The food was ok, but the price was a bit steep. Their BBQ food (duck, roast pork, so forth) didn't look too fresh. Their fish soup was delicious! They made it right then and there after you pick your fish. Will go back for the fish dishes and maybe on warmer time...

service is above average for Chinese restaurant. 
Food is good, but not great. 
Price is reasonable compare to the amount given.

Wow, the reviews are all over the board here.   IMO, this is good solid Cantonese food.   It's a small 'ma and pa' place with all the regular dishes you would find in any Cantonese place.    The dry beef chow fun is good, not greasy.   A bit short on the beef but it's cheap, I guess you could get extra meat if you really want it.   The fried flounder is also a bargainand real tasty.  I can practically eat all the fins (like fish chips) and bones (except for the main center bone)   The different casseroles are good.   My wifes favorite is the salted fish with tofu and chicken.  Could use a bit more salted fish imo, but then I like the smelly salted fish (brought up on it).   The above dishes are part of the lunch and evening (after 9pm) special menu, so they are a good bargain.   Another of my favorites is a non traditional appetizer of spicy fried calamari.  The roasted duck, pig, ...etc. are ok.   Prices are reasonable (great if you compare to strip prices) and portions are good.   Service is a bit hit or miss depending upon who is working and how busy they are. It's usually good.   I have never had a problem.  I have never had to wait more than 3 or 4 minutes for a table, maybe I'm just lucky.   It usually filled with Chinese who like this type of Chinese food (it certainly is not even close to local Chinese take out or panda express, or PF Changs, so if that's what you like, you may not like this place).   Very authentic.

This place is definitely not the best Chinese restaurant.  I'm not a fan of their food, but I keep coming back here for one great reason; their late night menu is so worth it! The late night menu is basically half price off their dishes and it's a great place to come to at 3 in the morning. You can order a lot of food for a cheap price. I come here to satisfy my late night hunger and it's easy on my wallet:) I recommend the Shrimp Wonton Noodle Soup for anyone who's craving something light and warm in your tummy. And if you want to just snack on a bunch of things, you can order duck, chicken and roasted pork for a cheap price. This place is traditional Chinese restaurant. Their specialty is live seafood. Pricey but food is very good. Service was not bad but still felt rushed during busy hours.
Had egg drop soup, salt pepper pork chop, lettuce wraps, Chinese broccoli... Wasn't impressed by any of it.
loved this place,everything is reasonable priced..and flavorful...been here many times, never being disappointed by em...singapore noodles is the MUST...althogh the restaurant is not that fancy...

I stopped by randomly one night and was pleased to see they had a late night special. -(after 9pm half off) I ordered one of my favorite dishes, Singapore rice noodles. Plenty of food and plenty of curry! I really enjoyed it and the price was right-$6!

Mom likes this the salmon head stew and steamed spare ribs. Me, not so much, though I don't like Cantonese style food in general. 

Pros:
- Popular with the Chinese crowd. 

Cons: 
- Utterly unmemorable food. 
- Slow service, if they ever pay attention to you.  
- Food is salty.

Definitely a good, authentic restaurant! Flavor is on point and service is very attentive. My family and I ordered a whole roasted duck, beef chow fun, sauteed mussels, and chinese broccoli with beef. Everything arrived in about ten minutes. The complimentary soup came five minutes before that. All the food was delicious and brought back nostalgic childhood memories. If you want that family owned, chinese restaurant quality, this place should be on the top of your list. The environment isnt loud even when busy. Highly recommend!!

Authentic Food- Check
Service - Check

Go before 5pm and after 9pm to order great food from the discount menu.

Las Vegans are so spoilt with Cantonese restaurants such as this gem.  

Don't miss black bean with fish fillet, YUM!
Scallops with black pepper on hot plate
Pea sprouts with garlic

We chose to try this restaurant on our second day of visit. First there are ample parking spaces in the lot. It is next to a Chinese grocery store for the convenience of shopping before or after the meal.

The menu has many dishes to choose from at fair prices. We settled for fried whole flounder, Buddha's vegetable feast, and steamed minced pork patty with salted fish.  

The fish came first. We like the sauce being put on the side and we can add according to our taste. It was crispy and soft! However, the other two dishes came much later. The vegetable feast was good and tasty with mushrooms, bamboo shoots, tofu, choi sum, and carrots. The minced pork dish was salty because of the salty fish. 

The meal came with soup of the house and red bean soup as dessert. They made the meal complete.  The waitresses did check on us a few times and helped to pack the left overs for us. They earned four stars.

Yet again another satisfying and enjoyable meal!  Tonight we had Beef Chow Fun, Chicken Fried Rice and Roasted Duck. Not to mention the sizzling plate that passed by enticing all our senses!!  Definitely returning!

Ok, so the four stars is my rating as if I didn't know about the whole health inspection from months ago. I made the terrible mistake of checking Yelp only AFTER I was seated at this restaurant upon the glowing reviews from my parents, who are Vegas locals. That made me super-conscious about the hygiene at this establishment.

To be honest, I didn't see anything too glaring or different than a standard hole-in-the-wall Chinese restaurant in terms of cleanliness. From the dining room I could see a bit into the kitchen, which looked ok to me. However, I did notice that while clearing a table they didn't use any cleaning sprays - just a damp rag - not good.

Food-wise, I have to admit that it's pretty yummy food at a more than fair price point. The crispy pork and duck meat cuts were stellar. I almost wished the food wasn't so good as it would make this place a much easier review. Our meal came with vegetable soup which was very tasty.

And no, no one in our party got sick after eating.

Perhaps they have cleaned up their act after the TV expose. Either way, my parents continue to frequent this restaurant with no problems, and I suppose if I were to visit again I would not be against coming here.

Came here on a recent trip to LV, I originally started looking for Dim Sum places but I started too late in the day so I waited for dinner and came across this little gem via my handy-dandy Yelp obsession. I would highly recommend this place for the quality and quantity of food for the price. I started with the house soup (that was ginormous) and then the 1/2 roasted duck, which was freaking delicious! They even brought out a green bean desert that was a first for me but I was very surprised at how good it was. This was all served with hot tea. The total was what shocked me the most. After tip it was around 15.00!!! I'm on my way back to Vegas today and they can expect a visit. Oh and the owner was super nice to top it off. The only thing to be aware of is the 10.00 minimum on credit card charges. Otherwise hurry up and get there!

Ok place for late night. Came here right after a chinese concert (Hacken Lee) on Feb 07, 2014. Pretty packed. Luckily got there with last open table otherwise had quite a bit of people waiting afterwards. 

This restaurants sports a cooked food and bbq area. Variety of cooked foods available to be ordered to-go. 

They had a lack of waitresses this night. As if they didnt expect the sudden rush. I was told they they are pretty busy at late night times, normally so didnt make sense to only have like 2 waitresses run around the entire restaurant. 

Prices were pretty good (late night special). 

First thing first (like every other chinese restaurant), the soup ! omg salty. first sip, ahhh omg its quite salty. like they didnt expect the rush of people, added a bunch of salt and water to increase the size of their soup pot... not good x_x 

1/2 a roast duck - $9.95 - roasted on site, im pretty sure. probably from earlier on the day though. skin was a bit tough to get through, wasnt crispy. we had asked for the sauces to be on the side as well, to keep the skin from soaking it all up but that didnt help the skin either. the smaller drumstick that attaches to the wing, had quite the few hairs/feathers left (picture doesnt really show but if you look at the smaller drumstick in the middle, it was almost covered in the hairs). 

Spicy liver thing - $6.95 - lots of dried red peppers cooked with onions and livers. At first glance, we were like "wahhh that looks spicy..." but we were quite disappointed. wasn't spicy at all. (sad face). flavor was pretty good but we wished it was spicy as the name had suggested, i believe. 

Bitter melon & Fish - $6.95 - uhhh not a fan of bitter melon. more bitter than what my mom cooks at home. but either way, still not a fan of bitter melon. fish was the tilapia? filets you can buy at like the asian grocery stores, frozen. 

Chicken w/ taro pot - $6.95 - the chicken, you can tell was a little fried, or cooked prior to being put in the pot with the taro. It was a bit tough/overcooked and dry. The taro was good but there was a little amount. Dish also includes some small pieces of ginger, mushrooms, and chinese sausage. Ok dish but mainly because i like taro. Chicken was eh. 

Overall. Ok experience. Not sure if id come here again. Prices were pretty good during late night specials.
Dont know how good the food is but if Ive been standing by the door more than 15' and no one greets?!! Not even a hello and ask how many people??
five stars restaurant! fresh seafood and nice service! I will come back!

I don't usually leave comments or reviews. Unfortunately, I can't let this one slide.

Food is really good that's why I recommended it to my brother-in-law who likes to eat good, quality food. ...and he did enjoy the food. We came back to eat today and we ordered Honey-walnut shrimp. My son is allergic to walnuts so we asked the lady to put the walnut on the side on a diff. bowl. We did tell her that my son is allergic. The food came and the walnuts were literally "on the side" of the shrimp. Of course we asked them to change the whole plate and they did agree. It came back right away and they said it was a new one that's meant for the other table. We didn't trust them and found, not 1 but 2 walnuts mixed in the mayo. They obviously just scraped the walnuts out. 

I won't be eating there again. It was life and death situation for my son. We were told twice that it was a new plate. Although, the food was good, I don't think I can trust them with my meal. Hope this helped. God bless!

Food is not good at all.  We ordered roasted duck for appetizer, but seems the duck was not fresh and more like an overnight thing. They also charged mandatory services fee of over 16%, no matter how many ppl you have and food you ordered.

Visited twice with friends. It's a great place to take your friends who enjoy authentic Chinese food. The prices are amazingly cheap but the flavors are not and the portions are generous. We ordered the duck & crispy pork (my fav) combo, cold whole chicken (including the head), eggplant, green beans, chow-fun and fried tofu. I ate till I couldn't anymore. Needless to say there was enough for take home. The restaurant was clean and well kept. Great spot for a lunch stop. BTW: they give away free soup at lunch. You won't be disappointed.

Food was good.  One of the better place to eat. 
Services are horrible

1.  Added 15% tip in my check without telling me after I gave them the credit card.  The initial bill was right.  Server told me they charge service fee to party 4 and more.  In the menu is 6 and more.  I almost called COPS on them.  

2.  My 4.3lb lobster is getting smaller.  Same lobster but missing couple pieces from waist down.   Server told me because it is fresh waster lobster.  (Are you kidding me?)

3.  Watch out a female server in black vest.  5'6", ear length hair, 45+ maybe 50.  She is kinda like the head of servers.  She is the one that charged me.

It's inadvertently become a New Years Eve tradition for the family to enjoy a meal together at Hong Kong Garden on Jones. Of course, we also visit periodically throughout the year but New Years Eve includes about 13 of us. Thank you to Hong Kong Garden for accommodating us!

A complimentary house soup is served table side, and there's always a scramble as several family members vie for a bowel with the coveted chicken feet. I'm impressed by how clean the bones are when they're done!

I'm addicted to their salt & pepper calamari - it's seasoned and fried perfectly! We also always order clams - this year we ordered them two ways: one in a black bean sauce and one in a ginger sauce. Both were very good! The vermicelli noodles were also a hit, and my Dad ordered the orange peel beef, which was very tasty. We usually order the bok choy, but since they were out we tried the snow pea leaves with garlic and they were such a hit they quickly disappeared, as did the bar-b-que fried rice.

The Peking duck is delicious (thank you for accommodating all 13 of us with one order!), and the remaining duck was happily enjoyed after devouring the delightful duck served with scallions & cucumber wrapped in delicate white pancake.

We tried a new hot pot this year of pork and mushrooms. This particular hot pot had a more delicate flavor and lots of rice.

We finished our meal with a complimentary serving of black bean tapioca, and it was a perfect way to end a very enjoyable meal!

Happy New Year!

Food was excellent! Ordered salt and pepper calamari, egg flower soup, crispy noodle with chicken, and salt and pepper pork chop. Everything was tasty and super quick to come out. Appetizer came out last though, and no refill on the waters during the meal. Tea was yummy. Definitely coming back! Oh and they are open late.
Don't eat here if you are really  hungry. It took 1hr before we got our food. Our kungpao is full of onions. Our tea pot is empty didn't get refill

I've been here a couple times and each time my family ask for no mushroom because of an allergy and every single time, they "forget" to not add mushroom. Even if I do speak to them in Chinese, requesting no mushroom because of an allergy... they still don't seem to understand or remember. 
I had the unfortunate chance of going to their bathroom before I began eating to simply wash my hands and when I walked by the kitchen area, it smelled like dirty sewer or broken old pipes, my sister and I had to hold our breathes going in and out and I'm surprised the smell didn't make it out to the dining area.
The one thing I did like was the roasted duck here and sort of the snails, but they were a tad bit too spicy. The beef fried noodles tasted like they added way too much msg, and the beef tasted like it was sat out for couple days too many. Their sweet and sour fish was overly seasoned with the sauce that I could barely taste the fish at all. I'd rather go to HK Seafood Garden which is maybe two street lights away, at least there... I know I won't be smelling dirty pipes and consuming massive amounts of msg.

Ask for the garlic spinach.  Its not on the menu but so tasty!  Oh but make sure you ask about the price-we found out later it was $13!  It was really great tasting, but seems to me that the price should be $7 or $8.  So for that price shock I am only giving it a three star rating.  We did inquire about the price of the spinach with the waitress but we didn't get anywhere.

The other things we ordered was salt and pepper chicken wings, seafood, tofu and pork hot pot,.  They brought out the soup with beef bone, vegetables and chicken pieces as an appetizer while we were waiting for out food.  It had a lot of depth of flavor which I assume was from the beef bones and warming to the body.  The waitress slopped it on the table when she served us, creating big wet spots on the nice table linen.  They also brought out the desert soup that I believe is made with red mung beans and I very much liked the taste of that.

I did enjoy very much the food we had and of course we had plenty to take home to eat later.  

I am rating three stars because of the waitress spilling our soup on the table in both bowls and for the high priced $13 garlic spinach.

I did very much enjoy the taste and quality of the food itself, so I definitely will be back for another try.
Probably my favorite Chinese restaurant in Vegas. This place is legit. We just stumbled upon it. Veryyyy happy we found it. Plus it closes at 6am! What!

So I've been here twice.. But my review is based off my most recent visit which was Sunday night 

We got there with a complete group of 8 and granted it was a busy night for them. But there were still tables vacant. We stood at the front of the door way for about 15-20mins before I got frustrated enough to go up to someone and ask when would we be seated. There also was another group of 4 waiting to be seated. 

I'm not trying to sound like there was a cultural preference... But while still waiting to be seated... Another group of 7 arrived (Chinese) and started talking to someone in Chinese about getting seated I'm assuming and they started to walk them to a table BEFORE SEATING US!!!  So I said EXCUSE ME!! And put a stop to that quick. 

So finally after getting seated... It was about 20minutes before anyone came to take our order. Again granted it was busy... But that should be no excuse. And remember that 7 person group that was Chinese trying to skip us... They ordered before us... And their food came out before anyone even came to get our order!! 

I HAD TO GO UP AND GET SOMEONE AGAIN to come to our table, take our food and drink order. They didn't even get our drink order... They had only served us hot tea. I was LIVID. We kept seeing others people food come out before ours and my patience was running thin. 

I promise you it was almost 45 before we GOT UP AND LEFT!! We were able to get two sodas and they were asking US TO PAY FOR THE SODA! And I had to tell them that is BS and it should be on the house!! My parents were livid and my mother even started a mild fight with the manager on the absolute HORRIFIC service we received!! 

The first time we went we brought them big business!! 33 people!! And the food was actually good and decent. And obviously our food didn't come all out at the same time but one at a time. - that's how it shoulda been on Sunday! They coulda given us the dam soup first at least 

I PROMISE YOU we are NEVER going back to this establishment

Going here is worse than slot machines.  Not only do you come out a loser, but you'll end up losing your faith in Chinese food.

1: why do you serve package dumplings?  More so, what drugs do the owners take allowing them to sleep comfortably?  This abomination should be avoided at all cost.

2: if you want a (lousy) dinner and a show, come here for the service.  Our feedback of "the food is not seasoned well" fell on deaf ears to the owner/manager.  As a kicker, we said it aloud in Cantonese and English. 

3: I'm giving one star to the busboy.  He was attentive, got us extra serving spoons, and refilled our tea faster than an Aria cocktail server.  Yes sir, that is why we tipped you separately.

I'm all for small businesses and helping to contribute to a family's dream.  However, I would sleep comfortably at night knowing this place goes under.

Me, cold?  Not as cold as the tofu fish.

Absolutely disgusting. My family and I came in here for dinner and it was really crowded, so we didn't have a place to sit. However there was one table was dirty so the waitress went to go clean it for us. I saw her, with my own eyes, clean the table and do you know what she did? She used the previous customer's leftover water and poured it on the spinning part of the table to clean it. She didn't even bother re-cleaning the table with some actual cleaning things either. I'm so disgusted that the people here think that's acceptable. Do they even know what cleanliness is?

Open til 6AM, family-style entrees for individual-entr√©e prices, and complimentary house soup to start with and dessert soup to finish with. Service is on top of it, attentive and quick.

Came in around midnight, ordered the seafood pan fried noodle and spring roll app.
Spring rolls were unremarkable- exterior freshly fried, interior mushy as if they'd been frozen, no bueno. The pan fried noodle was an enormous portion with ample seafood (two different kinds of squid, fish, scallops, and possibly clams?) and veggies (Chinese broccoli and carrots), and a portion of noodles so large we couldn't finish it together.
Total was $17, not bad at all.

Complimentary house soup and dessert soup were both appreciated, but taste-wise they weren't my thing. Will come back to try something else: menu is huge and has an insane number of dishes (200+).

I've been to this place three times including tonight. My first visit there was very enjoyable. Food was delicious and the waiters were on point. On our second visit, the food was good but for some reason the waiters were lacking customer service. We thought maybe it was a bad night for them. So tonight, we decided to order take out from there. When we arrived, it took a minute before anyone acknowledged us, then when someone finally did notice us, they weren't very friendly. The same woman that was rude last time, was very rude this time. No hello, just "what you ordered?" No thank you, no smile no give me a second I'll be right with you, no nothing. It's safe to say, we will not be going back to this place again.

AMAZING!!! Seriously one of the best Chinese restaurants here in Vegas. Not only are they open until like that wee hours of dawn, they have a great late night menu with prices unheard of in a city like Las Vegas.
Definitely my Go-To place whenever I'm craving yummy delicious authentic Chinese.

I always order the fish filet in black bean sauce. OMG sooooo MOUTHGASMIC! I also order the barbecue pork lo mein, The smoky panfried flavor on the noodles is incredible. I also get the sweet-and-sour fish fillet...one of the best sweet and sour dishes in town, and for $7.95 you can't beat that price.
The lady that's always working is always so sweet she totally caters to your table & makes sure that you have everything. You can tell she's a hard worker and genuinely cares about the people that come into the restaurant. So next time you're having that late night craving stop into Hong Kong Garden Seafood. You won't be disappointed.
Truly a hidden gem in this town.

Hong Kong Garden is AMAZING! The food was perfect, the service was on point, and the atmosphere was very welcoming. Everything on their menu is a must try at Hong Kong Garden because everything here is so delicious! It is definitely authentic! I would definitely go here whenever I want my Chinese food fix.Craving Chinese food? Go to Hong Kong Garden!

Unfortunately, this place had a few things that made it an awful dining experience.   There were flies that were incessantly landing at our table, on nearby plates, and reminded me of the joke: "Waiter, what's this fly doing in my soup?"  Answer: the backstroke.  So during much of dinner, I was swinging my arms back and forth.  We ordered an order of long-neck clams ($18 seems a bit expensive), seafood tofu hotpot, and on choy with garlic.  The next problem was finding bits of plastic in the seafood hotpot meaning that the frozen seafood was cut out of a packet carelessly.  Lucky me.  Wanna be lucky yourself?  Avoid this place.

First visit and a new favorite! Thanks, Anna, for recommending! 
Traditional Chinese goodies! Large menu and generous servings! Seafood hot pot for Grace and I had a very good pan fried sea bass!

First time here ....Authentic Chinese food really good !! Everything was so delicious! The service was excellent plus was seated fast @ great service @ the staff is very nice the place is very clean. Definitely going back again Love this place & food !! Plus with great company is the best!! We had duck, beef & broccoli, noodles, shrimp, I can just keep on going we had so much food one of the best was the desert black rice!!!' Yummy first time the best!!!!! & some Chinese Beer

I went out to grab a late night dinner with four of my friends. We order the calamari, honey walnut shrimp, salt & pepper pork chops, and the wonton soup. All was fine. We came, we ate, and we were about to leave. Until the waitress, a regular employee with a heavy chinese accent, stopped my cousin and our friend. I went over having been the one who paid for the meal, confused. Went I went over the waitress made no sense and we were all unaware of the problem. The waitress had kept looking at me and then pointing back at the check. I had thought I wrote down the wrong total, but I double checked and saw the total being $45.15 and seeing that I wrote $45.15... so what was the problem?

I didn't leave a tip. The waitress felt it was necessary to stop my group before leaving, and not ask, but told us to tip her. Before we didn't understand her until she asked, very clearly, "Where's my tip?"

I genuinely didn't believe she went out of her way for our good service. She didn't serve us any better than taking our order and refilling our water upon request. Adding upon that, I'm not in the position to have to leave a tip or be pressured into leaving one. Leaving a member of our group to give her a $50 and returning changed. Last I remember it's the consumer's decision and not the employees.

Unhappy with that employee single employee we interacted with. Unless you don't mind getting stopped, hear an employee ask for money.. I don't recommend eating here if you tip for good service.

update: 
August-Sept 2014
Price changed most on their Lunch/Late Night Special by $1.00 so now its $7.99 per order for meats/seafood and hotpot.

that price change made a big difference so family and friends are now back to our Vegas Hotel and Casino Buffet. Can't beat  all you can eat for less than $10 per person including drinks and tip!


June 2014
It's our regular to go to Chinese restaurant .... Serving is good. Price is fairly cheap and just love their complimentary hot soup esp.  Surely makes a big difference when youre really hungry and waiting for your food to be served.

The peking duck was so delicious!  Their menu selection is huge and everything we ordered was really good! Honey walnut shrimp, string beans with xo sauce, lettuce wrap, beef chow fun... Yummy! Highly recommended!

Disgusting!!!!  An employee came out of the ladies room wearing a blue latex gloves, the next minute i see her, she's food handling with same  gloves. I don't think they have proper training in food handling.

It is hard for me to go to other chinese restaurants whether I am in Vegas or L.A. The food here is decent but what sets it apart is that it is open late til 6 a.m., they give you complimentary soup, but if you go after 10pm if you order items off the smaller menu it is such a great deal!!!! Yeah the service is not the best, but it is better than most chinese places. I am in Vegas once a month and I always make it a point to stop here and eat the moment I drive in from L.A. usually at 4 or 5am.

Been here so many times. Best spot in town to get your Chines food fix. Very authentic down to the complimentary soup and sweets too. The portion are great size here. And it's all served family style too. So everyone picks an item. And you guys will be able to share for days. Hope you guys try out the Beef Stew w/bean curd. Plus the salt and pepper pork chop is a must!
good place for late dinner. they seem to have lots of great food, and local come here at night.
closed due aug 1st due to numerous health violations.  eat at own risk.http://www.southernnevadahealthdistrict.org/restaurants/inspections.php

Open until 6am daily, Hong Kong Garden Seafood & BBQ Cafe is a great option for anyone leaving the club around 4am and there aren't too many options left. They are located in the Las Vegas Chinatown not too far away from the Strip. They have quite the extensive menu with items you would find at a traditional Chinese restaurant + Hong Kong Cafes + Chinese BBQ shops. I love variety but quality can be compromised with so much going on. 

My friend and I shared a Honey Glazed BBQ Pork ($6.95), Sliced Pork and Century Egg Congee ($5.95) and Singapore Style Vermicelli ($5.95). 

They were surprisingly busy at the late hour we came so the food took a while to come out. The Honey Glazed BBQ Pork came out first. This is the Chinese style of BBQ where the meat is marinated in the pink sauce so don't confuse it with the American BBQ. The meat was tender and there was a thin layer of fat to it. It was a big portion for the price. 

Next came the Sliced Pork and Century Egg Congee. Congee is a rice porridge. I was in the mood for a bland warm soup so this definitely served it's purpose. There was also thin bits of ginger slices in here. My only critique is that they should change the name to Minced Pork and Century Egg Congee because it was mined and not sliced pork in the congee.

The Singapore Style Vermicelli is a thin noodle dish with been sprouts, pork and shrimp coated with yellow curry. My friend said this is her mom's favorite so it gives her the warm and fuzzy feelings when she sees it on the menu. On the other hand it made me a bit too warm cause there was a kick to these noodles with spices as well as slices of chili. 

If nothing else is open I definitely think that this place is a decent option, but during the more normal hours of the day I probably would not go out of my way for this place.

One of the my go to places here in the vegas area for chinese food. Prices are definitely a lot more than the San Gabriel Valley area in Los Angeles. 

Ive noticed the dishes are pretty small there now than before. So not as great of a deal when were paying the same prices but getting less.

This place taste way better when your drunk. Came here with the fambam, sober. Ordered so much food but nothing stuck out to me. We ordered practically everything on menu -- snails, crab, duck, curry, fried pork, shrimp, fish, etc.. 

We were a large party so we were given a private room. I could not understand a word our server was saying! We just kept repeating what we were saying which was getting kind of confusing! 

The staff was nice though. We had a birthday cake with us and they gave us birthday candles to put on em! They accommodated our needs when they were needed. 

Place is cheap too!

This Restaurant is very nice. The waitress's service is amazing, They are smiling all the time. Also, when we order the food , we just spent 10 minutes , we can eat the yummy food. The decoration of this store is beautiful too.

Love this place always be my late night Chinese stop by restaurant. The price is unbeatable plus they serve rice and soup with dishes we ordered. Reasonable price. But sometimes if they got busy it might be a wait, but I think it's worth it.

We came to this famous Chinese restaurant, ??????, for a happy reunion dinner. This is the "original", a new one is at Spring Mountain Rd. We ordered : Basil fried clams (??? ?? ,$12, delicious); Ginger and oyster pot (?????, $15, tasty); Lo mein (??, $9, classic); Onion pea ear (????, $17, very good); Steamed Flounder ( ???? , $8, scrumptious) and Peking Duck (?????, $30, a failure, probably it's Cantonese restaurant, they did not know how to make "Peking" dish). Restaurant's setting was decent. Service was so-so.

Impeccable food and service. Regardless of regular dinners or night meals, they are simply the first choice for us as they almost open all the time(until 6am!) For a picky Chinese palate, this is the best place to be satisfied at good prices.

This place is not bad; we came here for lunch cuz our family friends wanted to treat us before we leave Vegas. We ordered a bunch of cold dishes and I was actually pretty impressed with their sichuan dishes (even though it's called HK Garden, go figure). Anyway, we did try their seafood, including stir fried lobster and steamed grouper. The fish was really good, but the lobster was pretty average. The only other dish that I can remember was the Ong Choy in fermented bean curd sauce, and that was probably the best I've had so far. Because of this dish, I'm giving this place a 4-star rating, otherwise it would've easily been a 3-star restaurant in my book.

Anyway, probably would not be back here again, not worth a trip because of a veggie dish, but you never know. I may be in the mood for that again, some day.

Great price! Loved the food plus the price. Definitely loved the pork belly. The only thing I was very disapointed was the Salt and Pepper Pork Chop. When I ate this dish at Hong Kong Garden, there was tons if fat, oil, and starch inside the pork chop that I decided not to eat anymore. Compare to my other favorite chinese restaurant, has more taste, less fat, less oil, less starch, and more crispy. But overall the service and wait time was good.
Graveyard Specials!! Price was reasonable & their food was delicious. Server was polite and helpful when asked questions about the food. Love this place.

Here are a few good ones (pics posted by other yelpers):
