4. chicken gizzards and peanuts . Holy smoke, the peanuts were extremely good. It deserved a 5-star rating.

Rude server!!! We definitely not coming back, what a waste of money! We didnt enjoy our food because its all salty and not what you expected! Our server was rude and no respect for customer! Dont come here im warning you! Go some other place to eat! Dont waste your money and time! Bad service!!! Bad food!!!

Great place for authentic Chinese food (Not P.F Chang style). The price of the food is affordable and the service is good. I seen reviews complaining about the service but it is what you will expect from a fast paced chinese restaurant "Come, enjoy the food, be happy and get out". They are always busy and people are waiting at the door to get a table.

My father wanted to try this Chinese restaurant after seeing it so busy a week ago while passing by.  Food was just ok. Most customers in here are from China . So if you are not used to bland I wouldn't be eating here. 
Waitress with short hair and glasses was very nice and friendly.

This place isn't so bad. Open til the wee morning hours which makes this place popular. I came here with my mom and ordered the lobster which came out very nice.

All HK food is the same to me, but the service is nice and things were fairly clean. I'd come back only if someone else wanted to but not on my own preference.

Hongkong style food! Delicious original taste....located in Las Vegas with LA price and very good service. If you just miss HK food, drive here instead of jumping onto a Cathay Pacific seat, save your $.

They have great selections of lunch specials ranging from $4.95 to $6.95. 

We ordered salt and pepper pork chops (a must try! Good portion size for a lunch special), steamed pork with salted fish (it was good but I prefer the one from KJ Kitchen), bittermelon with spareribs (ordinary), Singaporean style noodles (very tasty). 

I gave this establishment a 4-star because of the service. The waitresses were not very attentive. 

All in all good food and great portion size for a lunch special in a Chinese restaurant.

Their seafood is really fresh. I like to get their Pearl Clam for $12. It's enough to split with another person. The scallion just brings out the freshness of the clam with the juices of the sea. I really like their combos as well.

I can get some duck, some roasted suckling pig and rice. The roasted suckling pig's skin layer is like chicharron. The meat is juicy and moist.I am also able to get soup before the meal begins. Their soup is simmering the whole day. You want to go later for the soup to get the most flavorful lotus roots, carrots and pork in the soup, but you don't want to go too late that you don't get  any lotus roots, carrots and pork. 

I have had their duck wings. I am a big fan of duck wings. Many people don't like duck wings because it's like eating crab... a lot of work for a bit of meat, but I really enjoy these duck wings. They're made with what would be translated to "old water" soy sauce. The flavor is immersed into the wings. The texture... smooth.

I often see the same people going here again and again, usually servers who get off work from other restaurants and want to enjoy a late night meal. They usually sit at the same table too. I have my table there as well. 

I didn't really enjoy their beef chow fun. That would be my one wish, that they could make better beef chow fun...

Their beef has gone bad. It looked light as pork. - June 6, 2016

You could say their beef's got beef with my small intestine. Been in the restroom all day. Good god! Health inspection, please. Beef is spoiled! Don't order the beef or you'll be in pain like me.

I've dined here a few times and my recent visit will also be my last. I spent the whole night throwing up, on the toilet, stomach aches and high fever. I have a strong stomach so whatever they gave me must've been helllllla contaminated for me to get food poisoning. Never ever will I step foot in this restaurant. !!!!!!! Boycott this place.

Came here for my mama's birthday and realized that my family's go-to place is always a Cjinese restaurant...no matter what state we are in!

Here's the breakdown:

1. PRICE: check in and get 5% off lunch and 10% off dinner. We ordered a gang ton of food... I'd say around 12 or 13 plates of ala carte.. whole bill was $193.00... and the. 10% off of that, and then automatic gratuity was added. Not bad right?

2. SERVICE: alrrightt... lets get down to the knitty gritty.. docked the stars for this one for a number of reasons.. one being the wait time. First order came in about 10 minutes later.. second platter came in 20 minutes later.. all in all, we waited a good 40 minutes for all 12 orders to come in. Lol! So we were already full by the time all food came. Fried rice being the last on the table. Servers were nice.. however, if you are picky about constant attention... you aren't going to get it here. Given it was a holiday weekend, it was pretty busy.. water took forever too.. 

3. FOOD: it was ok.. we ordered the seafood soup.. and boy did it need soy sauce and pepper. Could use a bit more seasoning... just sayin'. We also ordered the duck.. which was actually pretty good and moist. I would have to advise you not to order the fried chicken though...dry dry dry.. and practically burnt. Their mapo tofu was DELICIOUS!!!  Even just that and some fresh white rice... YUM! They also have this veggie plate called Bhudda something... it was ok.. wouldn't order it again. 

Overall.... this place could be better. Would I come back? sure... would I recommend it to others...? Mmmm, maybe as a last resort.

I went there today and server with short hair give me a bad attitude , we always going there to eat with our family , but since the server made 3x mistake with my 3x visit i stop right away . After 3 months ( today ) i need an emergency food , restaurant only 2 tables cover , but this server really really piss me off cause her attitude .. I just want to make sure my order is right but she yell at me from the cashier station , and makes all guest looking at me . Why u need to yell at small restaurant ?!? She only good when the owner at the spot ... I love the food but just because of her mistake i wouldn't go back there any more ... Period ... There is still bunch of good chinese restaurant a cross of the street ...no more hongkong garden . 2 stars just because the food is good ...
Just went in and busy no seats... stood there a few minutes and NOT ONE EMPLOYEE SAID A WORD TO US!  I'm Asian and I think they're prejudice!

This is a fabulous Cantonese style Chinese restaurant.  My friends are from china and they love it.  Is fantastic for American palate as well.  You can pick out your fish and lobster alive from their tanks.  They have a private karaoke room in the back that is available if you call ahead and makes for a great evening.

Waited for like 10 minutes to order my food,  and every time I got teased, when they would come to the counter where either need to order and they would answer the phone and walk away to get another order,  they will come back to which I thought was to give them my order and the would grab a receipt speak Chinese,  and walk away again,  so frustrating, when I order my food I wasn't sure if it was really understood what I was ordering.

fuck this place. worst fucking service out of all the typical bad service asian restaurants. you show up first and they give your table to people that show up after you. where is the health department when you need them.

Rather eat at Panda Express. Food and service is much better.

All I can say is damn good food. We started off by going to Big Wong but a friendly guy in the plaza said go to Hong Kong City instead we took off 2 minutes down the road. 
It wasn't busy when we got there after we sat down about 100 people showed up. The service was good they just had a lot of people to take care of so I'm deducting a star.
Ordered the Hong Kong city fried crab...holy batman it was awesome...I sat and ate the entire freaking thing. A must have if you go here. Orange chicken and shrimp fried rice also great.

This place is where Kan's Kitchen used to be.  I drove by there tonight on the way home from work and decided to drop by to check it out.  I wasn't planning to dine in so I just went in to check out their BBQ items.  Their whole chickens (soya sauce and salted flavor) were too small and not worth it for the price of $18.50.  So I opted for the BBQ duck, which was also the same price.  I also ordered their Zhao's Style marinated pork stomach.  Both items were actually quite tasty. The pork stomach had marinated peanuts in it.  If you need a BBQ fix, give this place a try.  This place opens till 6 in the morning daily.  I will have to come back and try some of their other items. Their menu is quite extensive.  Now Asian BBQ across the street (Jones) will have some competition.
Fast service with very good and good quality food. Authentic style Chinese with good sized proportions. Highly recommend and will be back.

Normal food with cheap price ,the lady is so rude for service,I remember
The time I ask her for some soup,she did not help me,just said something with heavy accent of English,until we finish,she have not done with soup,so bad service ,I feel bad with lunch here,so one star!!!

Lady was so rude to me on the phone that it caused me to not go. Such a shame that ive seen a lot of good reviews and i really wanted to give this place a try. Food isnt everything. Garbage service = no service.

I came here a few before but my last visit was the worst visit I order the Mongolian beef and it tasty like it was old and rotten omg and the fried pork chop was all batter no meat. The fried whole was extra oily. The worst part about this experience was my husband got food poisoning. He's been sick for 3 days now.

I came here with my family while they were visiting from California.  I guess they've been here before, and thought that this would be a great meeting spot.  We arrived at around 640pm.  I would say that around 7pm it starts to get VERY packed. 

The food was okay it wasn't mindblowingly great by any means.  I was with my SO and it was his and the kiddo's first time having an authentic chinese dinner and they seemed to enjoy the food. For the most part everything was fairly good and fresh.  Some items, like the veg were overly salty for everyone.  We had two duck dishes.  The traditional one with the soft white bun was fantastic! The other one that was in a cabbage leaf was a little over dry and lukewarm.  In total we probably ordered about 10 dishes.  

The service was okay. The were very polite and nice to all of us, but they didn't really refil our drinks as much as I would like, and when we asked for a sprite, it took about an hour and 2 requests to finally get it.  So I would say that it was sub par. 

Overall I would come back and get takeout, but I don't know if I want to sit and have dinner at the restaurant again.  The duck that was hanging on the hooks look delicious though!

I came to HK garden with large group for lunch at their private room. There is Karaoke equipment inside the private room in case you need some kind of entertainment besides food hahaaa. Everything I had was pretty authentic. My favorite dishes were pecking duck, lettuce duck wrap and steak on sizzling plate. This was actually my first time to have duck lettuce wrap. (Most Chinese restaurants serve shrimp lettuce wrap.) It was really flavorful and juicy. I enjoyed it a lot. I would probably bump HK garden to 4.5 stars for their good service. Our waitress refilled our hot tea more than 4 times during the meal and was very efficient. I will be back for more duck lettuce wrap!

We had dinner there last night.  There was 6 of us and the food was delicious.  The service was great.  The tea pot was always filled.  They refilled the rice and let us enjoy the company and conversation.  Didn't go there for atmosphere but the taste of food and good friends.  Go there to eat and enjoy the people you go with.
place is dirty and service is pretty bad. you get what you pay for. price is very cheap

Whatever you do don't order the live fish, they'll try and do a classic switcheroo. They probably do the same thing with any of the live seafood that they have. I've had live fish my entire life and I know the difference between a 2 pound fish and 3 pound fish. I can even tell the difference within ounces. And having fish my entire life I know how sneaky some restaurants can be with how they give you something that you didn't pick out and making you pay more for giving less. Now what they do is show you the fish that you pick out and when they go into the kitchen they give you a smaller fish than the one you picked out and in end you're paying a higher price for something smaller. Now their food isn't bad but knowing what they do just sours the whole experience. Don't be suckered like me and lose out for what you paid for.
Brother was eating here and told me to order me a take out.  Plastic string is in my food. This  is the second time finding shit in my food.  Eatters beware.

This restaurant was spoiled by success and has deteriorated. Chinese vegetable with garlic costs 17.50 (highway robbery.) Overall food quality is substandard. Service is terrible. A few days ago,Six friends and I dined there. I asked for a glass of water and it took 10 minutes with repeated request before I had my water. Our waitress was rude. I heard someone call her Yoyo. Yes, she is indeed a yoyo. The rest room had the pungent smell of ammonia. The health department should check them out
Food was delicious.  I love their Peking duck and walnut shrimp.  Service was on point.  Would definitely return.
Best Chinese in town.  Hands down.

I've really enjoyed coming here!  I've been coming 2-3 times a month and usually in the middle of the night when it's easy to get a seat.  This restaurant is a better value version of Sam Woo.

I normally order a rice dish and noodle dish and the tab comes to around $13.  Because the portions are generous, there'd be lots of leftovers for the next day.  The food value is excellent.

What makes the value doubly excellent is the free soup.  However, I'm unsure of the soup policy because once time when I visited in the afternoon, I wasn't offered the soup.  Perhaps you have to order a certain amount or it's available only at certain hours.  Maybe they should post their soup policy.

Took my mom to lunch, wanted to try a new place. #failed spent a pretty penny and was completely disappointed. $125 steamed live fish was crap. Too many Chinese food places in Chinatown. Don't waste ur appetite.

I am sick of this place and it's absolute crap service. The food is good, I'll give it that, and priced well. That WAS enough to warrant coming back to the ridiculously horrible service time and time again. Not anymore.

I don't know how, but their service has gotten worse since my last review. The two ladies that are always there at night really need to go. No matter how good your food is--and mind you their food is only good, nothing incredibly special-- your restaurant SUCKS when your service is s---. Seriously, how many times do I have to ask for a water, bracing myself for your eye rolls and side mouth scowl before you do your job?! Got all my food before I had to ask a different server for our drinks (two sprites and two waters, how hard) and only got the soda. I feel bad for the young guys here that are actually nice and have to deal with those women all the time. 

Honestly, I'd rather go somewhere else and pay more money for possibly less satisfying food rather than go to this place again. 

If you want to eat here, order to go.

We ate here for lunch today. The food was good but the service was terrible. I think they have different levels of service. If you are Chinese and speak the language, the service is better as we noticed. Not the same case if you are gwai lo, white skinned. Not a good experience. We had to ask for water, they brought the food out 10 minutes apart when ordered at the same time. Not good.

I love this place! I just wish I didn't live so far. Overall, this establishment and Diamond Chinese (behind Fashion Show Mall on Industrial) have some of the best Chinese food in Las Vegas.

Although I'm a confirmed carnivore, I have to recommend ordering Buddha's Feast as my #1 favorite. All tofu and vegetables in a rich sauce, but it's some of the tastiest and savory dishes I've ever had. I really can eat just this and rice and I'll be 100% happy.

Secondly, their ginger chicken (the cold chicken in the display + sauce) is incredibly tasty. Simple food!

Lastly, the service is okay (it's a busy Chinese place - what do you expect?) but overall I can tell that the servers, especially the female one with the short hair and glasses (sorry, I'm bad with names), try to make a good impression aside from being slammed with customers. I'd suggest going late at night or on the weekend at an odd hour. Really happy with their food overall!

Authentic Chinese cuisine. I go here and I'm the only person who is not Asian usually. I always eat giant clam which is prepared with cilantro and some kind of sauce. Always freshly prepared as well. I get the snails and black bean sauce it's a little spicy, tastes, and smells great tho. Crab meat and fish maw soup is what I usually start out with. I've had hot pot here a bunch of times. There is a really big variety of veggies, meats, and broths to choose from. The poached chicken and ginger sauce along with a roster duck, are some of the things I eat here regularly.

We've been going to this restaurant for 8 years now during their lunch special hours and it never disappoints. Fast service and consistent food taste ever since at an affordable price- that is if you dine here between 11am-4pm and between 9pm till they closing time of 6am.

I give it 4 stars because the ambience of this restaurant is not so good and didn't notice any improvements in the interiors. But that's not something that will prevent us from keep on coming back to this place. It's the authentic Chinese food that we are after.

I definitely recommend this place for their excellent tasting dishes.

Chinese food is legit here. 
You know how? 
If mom says the rice is good, then that means they know what they are doing here! It's all about the rice. 

What we had on separate occasions:
-Roast Duck and Roast Pork combo plate - I really liked the roast pork because it was basically roasted pork belly, sliced thin with crispy skin. The duck was meaty and tasty, but we did get some pieces that were not meaty. I guess, they all can't be meaty. 
-Green beans and scallops with XO sauce - the flavors were good but I would need to ask for it to be spicier next time. 
-Salt and Pepper Pork - I did not enjoy this because I found that most of the pieces were mainly fat. About 50% meat and 50% fat. 
-Stone Crab porridge - this is not on the menu and you need to talk to the server about their specialties. I think they may have just made this up? It was incredible because I got to eat the yummies in the shell! 

There is also a pre-prepared food counter if you need to pick up Chinese BBQ and food, fast. 

I would definitely come back, for some more roasted pork and crab.

came here on a friend's recommendation for dim sum. We ordered the normal dim sum dishes, sticky rice wrapped in banana leaves, rice rolls, sui mai, shrimp dumplings, veggie dumplings, over all i thought the food was pretty good. Not too greasy or too expensive.
We had a large party of 13 and had no problem getting service right away.
Wouldn't mind coming back

This is our favorite Chinese restaurant in Vegas! It's about 30min from the strip but definitely worth it! My grandfather is a professional chef and refuses to go out while we're in Vegas and cooks for the family instead EXCEPT if it's to go out to Hong Kong Garden. Everything is served family style, so you'll get a family sized portion for every ala carte order you make. Hot tea and a delicious soup with a savory pork broth and meat falling off the bones is served first. Steamed rice is also served with your meal. Must haves: egg whites and scallop fried rice, snow pilaf, salt and pepper shrimp, crispy pork, DUCK (duh), and their crispy noodles. Food and service is fast! The servers and workers are a humble and efficient people. We make a return almost every time we're in town, which Vegas being the 9th island of our home Hawai'i, is very often!!!!
Mess up while too many people.  Waiting for food like about half hour, service is bad.

We came here for Chinese New Year's Dinner with the whole family.  I wasn't too impressed with the food and my stomach told me that as well later on in the night. We had ordered half a suckling pig which was the best thing that was on the table. Everything else seemed overly greasy and even the shrimp fried rice had a funny taste. 

Service is what you expect at a typical Chinese restaurant...or rather lack of service. My husband's family ended up buying some of the roast pork to go for dinner last night and it was delicious. Unfortunately, I would say try the roast pork, but other than that don't waste your time.

Like any authentic Chinese Restaurant I have been to the service is not great. However we will always ignore the not great service and go here to eat because the food is soo good. Order the shredded pork pan fried noodles and the crispy roast pork.

If you come to this restaurant and only order one thing, let it be the salt and pepper pork chops!!! The fattyness and tenderness of the pork is AMAZING. We get this every single time we go. If you're not into fatty meats then don't order it. 

The food is a little bit on the greasy side but quite honestly, that's their style of cooking.  Or so I've been told by my wife who actually grew up in China.

The food was average here.  Had both better and worse Cantonese food. We were a party of 16 with 2 tables of 8, 9 adults and 7 children.

At least 8 of us were very hungry with little food for the day and hiking, so we were famished.

Pros:
- nice portions
- once ordered, food came out fast
- can accommodate big parties
- dessert supplied with dinner
- opened for Thanksgiving 
- owner came and thanked us for our business

Cons:
- tables jammed into the restaurant 
- had to ask multiple times for the same things before we actually got them
- service okay

Something with what I ate greatly bothered me about 2/3rds way through, which I was feeling fine before I ate. I think everyone else was fine, but for me felt like mild food poisoning.  Will give benefit of doubt that my system just objected to something.

Was sick for the rest of the evening but feel fine today.

Tips:
- make reservations as they can get packed easily
- come early
great food and Yoyo gives the best service!

My family today was searching for a place to eat our Christmas lunch that didn't have too long of a wait. In 15 minutes we got a table for 4 and had quite the experience. The inside was bit hectic but the servers brought everything we needed like white rice and tea. We got some duck, a seafood and tofu platter and also a plate of vegetables. The food and service was great even with a full restaurant, so I think it deserves 5 stars.

First timer introduced and treated by a local (my uncle) for my birthday. Excellent service! My uncle brought his own bottle of white wine from home and they didn't mind and offer to chill it for us as we wait for our food. 
There is many types of chinese food but as my uncle said u order what they are known for which is seafood and bbq chinese food and so we did. They even showcased the 5lb live lobster to get my uncle's approval before turning it into a delicious birthday lobster noodle.

The restaurant is a nice-looking, with a pretty well-furnished and clean, if a bit crowded, set-up. This is probably what I liked best about the place. The food is reasonably good too, although maybe a little on the oily, chewy side; the cold cuts are really good, the soup was questionable, and the duck was so-so. 
I'm very particular about the house tea, and they had great tea here, so plus points for that!

The service is lukewarm at best. I didn't feel very comfortable as a guest here, since I like to have even just a bit of interaction with the servers, at the very least a greeting...

My family seems to like it, so I'll probably be back again to see if my discomfort goes away, but only when I get dragged over after a visit to 168, probably.

Came here for a tasting. (Eating Chinese food in a group setting is always best so you can try lots of dishes!) The food is really good. I especially like the peking duck. It's a seafood and BBQ cafe but I didn't get to try their seafood items. For this reason, I'll be back and will see if they should get 5 stars.

As soon as I walked in, all 3 waitresses turned their backs and headed to talk among themselves in the back. After having stood by the door for a good minute, one of the waitress motioned me to a table. Didn't hand me a menu or asked what I wanted to drink. Right then, a Chinese (?) couple came in. They were greeted warmly and escorted to their tables. I'm Filipino by the way. 3 more minutes of waiting and nobody came to take my order. I just left...

Decent spot.  Not that great, but certainly could do a lot worse.  Rounded up to three stars because of the business hours.  All the usual suspects on the menu so no surprises there.  The BBQ and noodle dishes are not be as good as other places, but they get a pass because they stay open way late.  So really the main reason to come here is because most of the better HK places have already closed; and if it's that late at night, chances are you'll be pretty drunk so the food will be perfectly acceptable.

We ordered seafood pan fried noodles and the fish filet with black bean sauce. Both were pretty good. We also ordered a watermelon smoothie which came out more like juice. Dishes during dinner are family style and come with a container of white rice. They also automatically give you a pot of tea.

Servers are so rude , especially the girl she used to work at Chang restaurant 
I never come back. Horrible service !
So many Chinese restaurant in Vegas why we need to take that kind of hassle when we come here ? Go to KJ  kitchen , much better

Great food, good portion size. Price is reasonable. For dinner, they give you complimentary soup, rice, and desert congee. Fast service.

Should try their lamb with cumin sauce.

3.5 stars.....the food was ok but for the price it's a really good deal...so I'm split. 

They're super cheap and have great late night specials. 

Reasonable service...you do have to flag people down. Don't expect white glove customer service but for Asian restaurant standards, the service was pretty good. They were polite and helpful with food recommendations. 

Food:
Pretty authentic but they were stingy with the meat.

The Mongolian beef and stir fried lamb with green onions had great flavor, but there was very little meat in the dishes. The meat:veg ratio was way too low. However those were my favorite dishes.

Pan fried wide noodles(no gravy): not too greasy but pretty low on flavor...would not recommend.

Green beans in XO sauce: had great flavor but the green beans were over cooked. I like mine with a little crunch. 

Chicken soup with corn: way too much cornstarch...too gelatinous. Kinda flavorless.

They served a house soup(random bits and ends) which was pretty good and a red bean soup for dessert.

I'm on the fence about this....it's decent Chinese food(just nothing spectacular) and the service is pretty good. The prices are fantastically low...but if there was a tastier place with higher prices I would go to the more expensive place in a heartbeat.

This is a nice chinese restaurant a lil bit off the strip. Went for lunch at about noon and it was poppin'. They had the lunch specials that was like 7 bucks a plate. Not bad at all. We ended up getting a total of 8 plates, fed 8 ppl for 65 bucks. Not bad at all!!

This place is not bad; I once again declare. Seafood is our favorite . The geoduck sashimi making a big ship . Very impressive,There are pictures of appreciation.
We ordered two geoducks About 4 pounds, three approaches: 1Geoduck sashimi parts of the nose with mustard . 2Geoduck  stir - fried. 3Geoduck tofu soup , very delicious.

cold dishes-many types . Every time we has ordered different .I prefer to eat spicy, but my fiance does not like spicy food .The waiter very smart, every time in advance to prepare a chili the oil dish - (Finally, we give them about 20% tip).

But once I was very disappointed. We ordered the garlic crab . The waiter delivered to the table next to Hong Kong women. The next table was not ordered garlic crab. However, they are ate garlic crab and did not declare that they have not ordered .I was very angry that crab. we need to waited again, however, we have arrived  full, we decided to cancel garlic crab.

Why angry gave five stars .Their seafood is really best (Mustard need to improve).Waiters make mistakes, Everyone will have the wrong time, but we sometimes can remind . If I have not ordered the food . I will not directly eat.
yes the food is incredibly authentic chinese but it has been discovered and now extremely busy. come early to avoid the madness and crowds.

Try their geoduck sashimi which comes in on a sushi boat, meat are fresh... lobster with ginger and green onion, pretty tasty..if you like authentic Cantonese food, this is the place ...they have lunch special and serve free house soup, service is as expected in a Chinese restaurant.
decent authentic cantonese food. peking duck was really good. reasonable price with big portion. open till 6am with late night menu. good choice for late night cravings and after party goers.

I stopped by here at very late night Saturday.. this place opens till 6am.  The price of the late night food was pretty fair and the food was good as well. 

You can't expect a fancy interior nor service here but it you are looking for some authentic Cantonese food in a late night with fair price. Then it's a good place to go.
The food here is excellent and so is the service.  The place is so busy and they try their best to accommodate the customers.

this place is terrible extremely worst service.. if youre not chinese they will and i say wiiilll literally push you aside so other chinese people can come in! which i dont get because im asian also. theyre rude and we had 3 families who spoke to the workers in chinese to let them sit before you do. and when you confront them they will ignore you and give you dirty look the entire time you are there. EXCEPT THIS ONE AMAZING WOMEN WITH SHORT BLACK COOL HAIR AND IS THE MOST DOWN TO EARTH AND NICEST PERSON THERE!

One of the best things about this restaurant is definitely the fact that it is opened late for the people who are hungry at a ridiculous time of the day. 
When I come here, I always come with a group of friends because all the dishes are family style so therefore it is quite large. We always start off with a fish soup. It is very tasty, just add a little soy sauce. The honey walnut shrimp is not overly sweet and the portion of the shrimp is pretty generous. I also do love the taste of the Mongolian beef, however I feel that the ratio of meat to onions and peppers is ridiculous. It is more like onions and peppers with a side of beef. Even with that fact I still continue to order it just because the beef tastes good! The pan fried scallops with bean sauce is nothing special, but I would order it again because the sauce is great with rice. My friend really likes the eggplant dish. I prefer eggplant fried but for those who are vegetarians this would be a great choice!
I continue to come back because the food jd family style and tastes good. The service will suffice but don't expect that much from a fast paced Chinese restaurant.

Found our new Chinese restaurant...it's cheap like LA Chinatown..the people aren't friendly(which is what I am used to) but they cook their food right..I ordered mandarin pork chop, salt and pepper shrimp, seafood pan fried noodles, pan fried flounder all for under $40 and I have left overs that would feed another 3 people..I'm satisfied with my wallet and my pallet..
I was introduced to this by my husband , who was told by a friend . Best fried rice in town even better if you have a chance to dine . And it's open way late .
Great place to eat late and awesome price! I love the green beans XO it's delicious and I can't have enough!!

My go to Chinese food place, everything so far that we've ordered is fantastic! Had their hotpot for the first time and it was worth the money. The service can be slow at times and the waiters can seem rude( they're really not)  but I'll take it for good food as always
love the food, Peking duck, Mongolian beef, beef and brocoli are all great. Come late night for a big discount on the menu.

Normally my family is particular about sticking to the tried and true Chinese restaurants. It is rare to get my mom and dad to deviate from their regular rotation. When my dad suggested this place, it took me by surprise. The Yelper in me is always in search of a hidden gem.

HK Garden is not that kind of place. It is jammed pack with tables of screaming, uncontrollable children. The Asian teacher in me wanted to expel some corporal punishment, but decided against it. A few stern looks were enough to get them into the seat next to their mother. 

The service is lacking. Of course, it is lacking, it is a Chinese restaurant. Of course, I am going to get ignored when I need them most. 

The food is a hit or a miss. 

The seafood and tofu hot pot: hit. 
The mapo tofu: miss.
The porks blood and intestine hot pot: hit.
The HK sweet and sour spare ribs: miss.
The whole fried flounder: hit.

Apparently if $40+ is spent, you get a free entree. We got the flounder. There is something else for $80+.

We are regulars here and we love the restaurant. Everything here is awesome, soups, fried rice, duck, pork, cumin lamb all delicious. Service is prompt, prices are good, they take Visa and Mastercard and you have great open shopping center parking. They are also open all night so pop in for a bite.

If you need a place to get the freshest and most authentic Chinese food in town, Hong Kong Garden Seafood & BBQ Cafe is the place to go. Whether you are craving peking duck, lobster, or even freshwater eel, this restaurant will definitely fulfill your cravings. Whenever I go here, I get THE freshest seafood and I am never disappointed with their dishes. There was this AMAZING waitress here that was able to provide me with extraordinary service and a welcoming atmosphere. I've been to a lot of Chinese restaurants here in Vegas and nothing compares to Hong Kong Garden. I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a place with fresh and authentic Chinese food!

Typical chinese restaurant, medium size of restaurant so many guest but only 2 servers. Only 1 who take orders. The wait for the food is pretty long. When I asked the server, about the food, she didn't bother to respond. Food finally came after 35 min uses of waiting. Food is typical chinese nothing special.

Alright.. i got to ADD to my review. This written 7 hours later. I got sick right after I was out from this restaurant. In fact, my tummy was not feeling great while I was eating my lunch. therfore I didn't finish my food then. Both my son and I got stomach ache. I almost vomit in front of my car and try to stay positive about it (thinking can not be from this restaurant) but after 7 hours, I must said got to be some fish filled or shrimp that I ate, they may not be fresh. Overall, this restaurant is not worth it, bad service and bad food. Too bad I have to take one star out of my review.

I'm a big fan of this Chinese place, they have some of the tastiest duck/Peking duck in Vegas.   All the dishes are relatively cheap with large portions.  They have a BBQ deli area where you can order to go as well as sit down dining.  This is one of the smaller Chinese spots so not a large banquet hall like HK star.  All the dishes I've had have been good if not better than places like KJ kitchen and HK star.  One of the dishes that was stand out was the ginger/green onion sauce clams.  Delicious....only wish there were more!  The flavors were pretty spot on for the fried rice, seafood chow mein, beef chow fun.  I'm a big fan of the snow pea leaves stir fried with garlic as well.  The salt and pepper pork chops were tasty as well, and not over MSGed...we all know there's MSG sprinkled on these and there's no avoiding it!  I would say the food is on par with KJ kitchen and HK star but the prices might be a tad bit lower for some of the dishes.

I like the food but the service is soooo slow.  We've been sitting Ms waiting for our food for over 30 mins.  I may not come back here they probably have 2 cooks and they only have 3 servers.  But this is Chinese a restaurant

One of my most favorite place's to eat.Specially late night because they have the best price and big portions on the late night. The food there taste very good specially the Singapore style noodles and the five spice beef..pretty much what ever you get tastes good...they have a huge menu so many different things to try...but when i go there i always see Chinese people ordering way different stuff from what we order only if i can figure out what they eat lol...

The food is good here.   Not quite traditional Chinese but a pretty good facsimile.  The fried chicken was a bit bland and a bit dry.  For some odd reason they paired it with a sweet and sour sauce that was sickeningly sweet.  The chow fun beef noodles were fantastic as was the Chinese broccoli.  

I prefer the other location on Spring Mountain for many reasons. 

First, the place was packed and they were hopping.  The problem is there is no waiting area so those queued for a table mill around the people eating. 

The servers run around like madmen putting food out and work very hard.  But they make you feel rushed because they take plates as soon as they are empty.  The whole vibe is " sit down, order, eat and GTFO so we can seat the the next people".  It is an uncomfortable.  

The place is very small and the tables are super close together. You get to hear what the other tables are discussing and moving around is awkward. 

Lastly, there was a table of 6 that brought their dog.  Who brings a dog to a restaurant for a sit down meal?   The damn thing took off like 5 times and the owner had to chase it down.  Leave your dog at home FFS.  Not everyone finds dining with dogs acceptable.
Attention!!!The customer service is disgusting. They never smile to customers. I made to go order,the lady who took my order is very rude. Never come again.

Hungry after the Ka show at MGM, so we were looking for some chinese food to fill our tummies.  This one looked fairly crowded inside, as it was on the late side, around 9:30 pm.  Realized later that they had a special menu that was reduced in prices after 9 pm?  I think 7.95 was the most expensive item on the menu.  We just shared a rice plated that had assorted seafood, chicken and bbq pork.  The plate was covered with rice, and it was mostly rice vs seafood and meat on top.  That dish was 6.95.  The other dish we ordered was shrimp won ton soup.  It came with noodles and about 4-5 won tons.  There was also some chinese veggies too.  Broth was decent.  We also got free house soup.  If I had known that, I would have ordered a different dish instead of the won ton soup.  Food was decent for the price.  I can't believe the number of people coming in to eat at this hour... and it was a weekday too.

Not my first time here but the food isn't priced too bad and the taste of the items are pretty good.  I like to get the eggplant and tofu hot pot and i ask them to make it spicy.  The clams in black bean sauce is good, seafood pan fried noodles is great also.  I also find the pan fried flounder to be excellent.   If you come late at night they have the pricing  cheaper than if you come  during dinner time.

come here 10:20pm ordered food by 10:35pm then house special chow win show up, flounder show up (around 11pm ish) during this time asked servers many times what happened to our salt and pepper pork chop order both girls servers keep saying coming coming coming! 11:09pm finally salt and pepper pork chop show up!!! no sorry no explanation just drop off the salt and pepper pork chop to the table!!! what a horrible services is this?!? notice all this servers pay more attention to the chinese speaking customer instead of none chinese speaker!!! holy sh*t talk about bein unfair service this is by far the worst even tho we have vip card i guess it really means nothing not even a dair treatment of service!!!

This place was really Chinese - enough that I kind of felt out of place, so I guess you can safely say that its authentic Cantonese food. We got beef chow fun dry, which was kind of funky tasting - not spoiled (I hope) but the beef just tasted funny. The fried tofu w gai lan and fungus was surprisingly good. My Chinese friend said its the only place in town she's found that serves the fungus - interesting, they're chewy and look like mini versions of the natural sponges you use as wash cloths. 

Food is cheap I think both dishes were $8 each and you get free soup and dessert so it's a 3 course meal for $8 if you eat in. The free soup wasn't just pork bones and cabbage like other Chinese places - it had big pieces of pork, lotus root and carrots. My friend called it MSG water, but whatever it was free, so no complaints here. Dessert was a warm tapioca soup - tasted like there was bean paste in it too. 

The BBQ offerings look promising, I'm definitely going back to try that sometime. I saw on the menu that they do whole roasted pigs for $200. May need to consider that for the next big party. They also had a baby pig option for I think $160

Worst customer service ever. We came today @ 10am and were the first customers. We sat down and the waitress gave the menu. As we are still trying to check what food to eat, she brought a pot of tea. We wanted to eat dimsum and i asked her about it she told me they dont have it. It's the other branch that serve dimsum. So ok i said we will just go there. And then she told me ow you have to pay for the tea. WHATTTTT!!!! We did not asked for it we did not drink the tea we did not even touched it why should i pay for it..and then she told me do not ever come back here.Is this the kind of employee that you hire no good manners and right conduct.. feeling annoyed we did not go to the other branch instead we went to Orchids garden. Good food and best of all good service.. they asked you if you want tea. They just dont serve it and let you pay for it.. will not go back to Hongkong Garden

Great experience, this little Asian seafood diner is fantastic if you know what to order and when to order it. If you can manage to adjust your expectations, you can have a great dining experience too. 

What to Order
Order anything salt and pepper style, mapo tofu as hot as you like it, roast duck, Peking duck, or roast pork. When I return I will report on the seafood. The servings are substantial compared to anything near the strip and the prices are difficult to beat for the quality and quantity. 

When to Order
Do not arrive during high traffic times for lunch or dinner. People are aware of the food-to-price ratio. We arrived at 2am. There were only a couple of tables filled. The service was very good, drinks always full, and dishes arrived hot

Great place when not busy!
